summary: This is an email from a Financial Program Specialist at the Federal Bureau of Prisons regarding a delay in receiving fiber cable for camera systems at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The document is marked as sensitive and is part of the Epstein case document set, suggesting it may relate to infrastructure or security at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

persons.name: Financial Program Specialist
persons.context: Author of the email, working for the United States Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, providing an update on a procurement delay for camera system installation.

events.title: Email regarding camera system installation delay
events.description: A Financial Program Specialist emails an update stating that fiber cable required for camera systems has not been received, halting installation progress at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional CTR 150 Park Row New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated April 1, 2019, concerning procurement and installation of camera systems at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
It indicates a delay in receiving necessary fiber cable, preventing the installation of camera systems.
The document is marked as sensitive and is part of the Epstein case files, potentially relating to the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated.
